document.topic_text: Houston Rockets release 2016-17 schedule KHOU.com Staff , KHOU 5:01 PM. EST August 11, 2016 General view inside Toyota Center. (Photo: Troy Taormina, USA TODAY Sports, Troy Taormina) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST HOUSTON – The Rockets released their 2016-17 schedule Thursday. Rockets fans will get their first look at the Mike D’Antoni-led team Oct. 26 against the Los Angeles Lakers in LA. Houston’s first home game is Oct. 30 against the Dallas Mavericks. The team then travels to Cleveland to face the NBA champion Cleveland Cavaliers on Nov. 1. MORE: Click here for the Rockets' full 2016-17 schedule The Rockets host the Phoenix Suns the day after Christmas and the New York Knicks on New Year’s Eve. Houston Rockets guard James Harden (13) celebrates after scoring a basket during the third quarter against the Oklahoma City Thunder at Toyota Center. The Rockets won 118-110. (Photo: Troy Taormina, USA TODAY Sports, Troy Taormina) Houston welcomes Golden State to town Jan. 20. The team ends its regular season April 12 at home against the Minnesota Timberwolves. MORE: Houston Rockets offseason news The Rockets are coming off a 41-41 regular season in which they lost to Golden State in the first round of the playoffs. The team hired D’Antoni in the offseason, who replaces interim coach J.B. Bickerstaff after he took over for Kevin McHale, who was fired 11 games into the season.
